pullRequest.body:
Add `mgf_gaussianReal`.

Compute the mgf of Gaussian.

Co-authored-by: Siyuan Ge <jamesgsy@uw.edu>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [a5f1ab4c7c](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19896/commits/a5f1ab4c7c7dc25eaa3a06cebd99804d34972d72)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Probability.Distributions.Gaussian | 2095 | 2103 | +8 (+0.38%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Probability.Distributions.Gaussian`|8|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ aemeasurable_of_map_ne_zero`
`+ mgf_const_add_left`
`+ mgf_gaussianReal`
`+ mgf_id_map`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Can you also add a lemma (in this PR) for the mgf of a general gaussianReal and also add cgf versions?

To have Omega be a type in any universe:
```suggestion
theorem mgf_gaussian { : Type*} {m : MeasurableSpace } { : Measure }
```

We require spaces before and after `:` . Also you can remove some parentheses and use dot notation for `Measure.map`.
```suggestion
    (X :   ) (hXm : Measurable X) (hX : .map X = gaussianReal 0 1) (t : ) :
```

```suggestion
  mgf X  t = (.map X)[fun x => exp (t * x)] := by
```
Same suggestion everywhere else you use map.

I won't insist that you use dot notation everywhere (it's not required by the style guide), but here is an example in case you find it nicer:
```suggestion
      (measurable_exp.comp (continuous_const.mul continuous_id).measurable))
```

You can probably remove the type indication and some parentheses (untested):
```suggestion
  _ =  x, exp (t * x) * gaussianPDFReal 0 1 x := by
```

does the following work?
```suggestion
    congr with x
```

```suggestion
  _ = exp (t ^ 2 / 2) *  x, gaussianPDFReal t 1 x := by
```

You could turn that first step into a lemma:
```lean
lemma mgf_id_map (hX : AEMeasurable X ) : mgf id (.map X) = mgf X  := by
  ext x
  rw [mgf, integral_map hX]
   rfl
   exact (measurable_exp.comp (measurable_const_mul _)).aestronglyMeasurable
```
Almost everywhere measurability should be enough? That is, replace hXm by `AEMeasurable X `.
The hypothesis can then be removed entirely, since a.e.-measurability is a consequence of `hX`. Indeed `.map X` is defined to be zero if `X` is not a.e.-measurable.

I added a supporting lemma `aemeasurable_of_map`. It seems like it should already exist in mathlib but I could not find it. With it, I can easily remove the hypothesis `hXm`.
I put the new lemma in MeasureSpace. Do you think it belongs there?

pullRequest.title: feat(Probability/Distributions/Gaussian): add `mgf_gaussian`
